Meaning: flour, usually made from legumes or nuts
The abrstia is an analogue of Terran chickens but with fibrous feathers which can be woven into cloth and is known from fossil records and genetic studies to be a native Zhdant life form.
Pliebr's innermost satellite in the Zhdant system (orbit 0).
grasper, a person who is greedy. Has come to apply to hoarders and miserly individuals.
silent grasp. Also the name of an attack speeder.
of, when used to express a quantity of a specific item
Harvest, the season on Zhdant to harvest mature crops.
Waning, the season on Zhdant when the hot summer weather becomes temperate.
The first Psionic Games. Used to refer to the beginning of the Zhodani calendar.
A Triple Olympiad, or cycle of three Zhodani Olympiads, containing 2200 zhdanstial, or 2476.76 standard days
Triple Olympiad Day, a holiday added immediately after every third Olympiad
Thaw, the season on Zhdant of melting of winter ice and thawing of frozen ground
Raining, the season on Zhdant associated with spring rains and the planting of crops.
Chill, the freezing winter season on Zhdant.
barbarian. Often used in a derogatory sense to refer to Imperials.
Pliebr's fifth satellite- a gas giant in the Zhdant system (orbit 4).
falsehood; can also mean 'no' depeding on context
conditional nor; when neither of two conditions are true

a large, pulpy fruit from a plant that grows along riverbanks. It has a leathery husk surrounding a sweet interior. The seeds are toxic to most native fauna and induce vomiting, diarrhea, and death. Zhodani, however, harvest the pulp and seeds, drying the latter to create a spicy powder used in many of their local dishes. Visitors who have tried it describe the experience as ?hellish.?
a suffix generically referring to curry dishes, but more commonly for any dish that specifically uses the spice from chechicheli
Zhodani megacorporation known for farm and factory machinery- robots and vehicles.
to play, to play with something
to merit, to surpass a standard
good morning; morning greetings (implies before dawn)
a six-legged arboreal herbivore native to the temperate forests of Zhdant and resembling a Terran squirrel
Zhodani year containing 244 zhdanstial equivalent to 274.7 standard days. Every third chten has one additional zhdanstial.
Consulate province consisting solely of Chtierabl sector- 250 parsecs coreward of Zhdant.
Enterprise. A 2000-ton council cruiser is often assigned to Qlomdlabr members or their agents for special missions.
to be required to; must do
Stellar farers. Official name for the Fifth Core Expedition.
A famous Army lift infantry commander from the Second Frontier War; name of a Zhodani Grav AFV.
to be related by function or purpose
The asteroid belt in the Zhdant system (orbit 3).
The larger of Zhdant's two continents where prehistoric development of the Zhodani took place.
An ancient Zhodani city on Zhdant which served as the capital of the Viepchakliashtie Empire and in modern times is the capital of the Consulate.
possessive "of", indicating possession of a thing or relation to a person (wife of, son of, etc)
Sunbright. Dranzhrin is the Zhodani New Year and as a holiday falls between Atpaipr and Atrint.
Sunflight. Dranzhrinatch is a melancholy time for the commemoration of the dead taking place between Vrienstial and Atchafser.
The Zhodani development company that developed a working prototype of the jump drive.
representative; 'one who represents'. The Zhodani title for a council member often translated 'Consul'.
The combined plagues which devastated Zhodani civilisation and left the Qiknavrats and Viepchaklts extinct.
a pejorative implying depravity, extreme disgust, or perversion, also used to imply a catastrophic event
the plague that caused the Second Dark Age
A large carrion-eating flying creature native to Zhdant.
a large bird resembling a vulture, native to Zhdant
Pliebr's sixth satellite a small airless world in the Zhdant system (orbit 6).
'controller of controllers'. The Ancient artefact that controls the settings of the Erdriap Chensh.
'controller of wills'. The Ancient artefact that devastated the central subsectors of Zdiedeiant sector in the ƒ??5200s.
Unofficial term for the Chirpers found on Evaduts Brem (1909 Ziafrplians).
'the book of morality' the 'holy book' which governs the Tavrziansh philosophy.
'guardians of the book' the small academic and secular organisation which governs the content of the Fevranzhtavr.
'the book of superior morality'. Revised version of the Fevranzhtavr used by the religious dictatorship on Batlpat (1326 Ziafrplians).
'yonder chilling thought'. Phenomenon discovered by the Seventh Core Expedition.
The goal of Tavrziansh union with Tavrian the universal energy field.
'wasteland'. Refers to all territory coreward of the Consulate proper and includes the provinces of Obrefripl Chtierabl and Vlanchiets Qlom.
Consulate province which includes Zdiedeiant and Stiatlchepr sectors.
following; also used to refer to the galactic compass 'trailing'.
Consulate province which contains the Zhodani portions of Yiklerzdanzh  Afachtiabr (Far Frontiers) Iakr (Foreven) Briakqra' (Gvurrdon) Tloql (Spinward Marches) and all of Ziafrplians sector.
Name of a class of Zhodani G-Carrier.
conditional 'and', meaning both or all conditions are true
Zhodani megacorporation known for computers and software.
Zdetl term for the Ancients as a race or culture explicitly separate from modern Droyne and Chirpers.
conquest. Also the official name of the Third Core Expedition.
compass; an instrument for measuring angles and arcs
Consulate province which includes the Zhdant and Tienspevnekr sectors. Jadlapriants includes both Zhdant (2719 Zhdant) and Addax (2214 Tienspevnekr)  along with the rest of the Addaxur Reservation.
range or extents, as in mountain ranges or forest extents.
A large Noble estate on Zhdant.
Well-born. Character with Social Standing of 12.
A hardy tuber analogous to sweet potatoes.
civilize. Also used as the opposite of 'baz.'
Harvest. A traditional harvest festival held between Ataniebl and Atshtiavl.
port, as in the left side of the ship when facing forward
a cluster fruit that grows in the forest canopy and has been compared to a combination of Terran bananas and papayas. Commonly used as a pureed base for soups, salsas, and curry dishes.
Name of a common class of 50-ton heavy fighter in the Consular Navy.
"kaiju" - from ancient Terran videos of giant monsters
an insult referring to someone psionically strong but untrainable and dangerous
A sessile carnivore that traps its prey by mimicking a pool of standing water
to serve, as in offer food to
patient, one who is a patient
A grazer native to Zhdant, kept as cattle for meat, leather, and milk.
The kredl is an analogue of Terran cattle native to Zhdant.
A trading combine that operated in the trailing frontiers of the Zhodani Consulate between ƒ??2800 and ƒ??1800.
to suppose, implies lack of certainty
Consulate province which includes the Zhodani portions of Tsadra Eiaplial and Sidiadl sectors.
to have permission, to be allowed
Highest honour bestowed by the Consulate on its citizens. Often translated into Anglic as the 'Consular Legion of Merit'.
for, in order to, for the purpose
An old and reliable class of 100-ton scout ships.
The noql is an amphibious crawler raised in dammed streams but is known to not be native to Zhdant.
of, when used to express a general quanitity
Consulate province which contains the scattered worlds between the provinces of Iabrensh and Chtierabl.
out of, when used in comparisons
a theatrical performance, an opera or play
'xnor', both or all conditions are true or false
'xor', or 'either one or the other but not both, used when there are several choices that cannot be simultaneously true
Pliebr's second satellite (orbit 1) in the Zhdant system.
Solitary K0V star that Zhdant orbits.
to say, to utter a sound
'or', meaining either condition can be true
to levitate; to move something telekinetically
'princely born'. Character with Social Standing of 15. Used as the name of a Zhodani attack speeder.
'area'. Often translated in Anglic as provinces preqlianz are intermediate governments between the sector councils and the Qlomdlabr on Zhdant and are kept roughly equal in population.
'military shipping'. Zhodani megacorporation responsible for interstellar transport and passenger service.
'forceful reach'. Name of a stellar main that extends from Kronor (0304 Tloql) to the spinward edge of Ziafrplians sector.
raven; a raven-like creature native to Zhdant and having intelligence similar to the Terran analogue
Subsector (H) in Zhdant sector in which Zhdant (Zhdant 2719) is located. Often misspelled 'Gaval' by Imperials.
The smaller of Zhdant's two continents. Used as the name for a modern class of Zhodani grav tank.
The 'people of Qiknavra'. The Droyne/Chirper race that dominated Qiknavra during Zhodani pre-history until the Dzagtlas made them extinct.
any of several species of avians analogous to terran hummingbirds
The Supreme Council of the Zhodani Consulate the highest council in the Zhodani government which meets on Zhdant.
'ruling councillor'. Often used as a title for the supreme executive of a world.
General term for various species of bee-like pollinators
'journey'. Official name for the First Core Expedition.
good journey'. An 800-ton liner used in the core regions of the Consulate.
One of six Zhodani seasons containing 40 zhdanstial equivalent to 45 standard days.
moon. Used generically for any moon as opposed to Viepchakl Zhdant's moon.
'moonlight'. Name of a class of 600-ton patrol frigates.
'mountains of moonlight'. A dominant mountain range on the continent of Qiknavra on Zhdant.
Eusocial, terrestrial insects analogous to ants
'not', implying that either an expression is false or a comparision is false (as in A but not B)
Consulate province which includes ltvikiastaf sector and the Zhodani portion of Tlabrieish sector.
Name of a common class of 400-ton system defence boat.
a food item introduced by Solomani visitors and traditionally eaten on Fourth Day
Zhodani megacorporation known for the design and manufacture of civilian starships.
'thought police' the organisation that combines law enforcement and mental health care in Zhodani society.
The 'universal energy field' from which Tavrziansh teaches all spirits come.
'morality's path' the state supported philosophy taught across the Consulate.
indicates a thing made from the root word
'olympiad day' which is a special holiday inserted between Atshtiavl and Atpaipr every third year.
An olympiad or cycle of three Zhodani years containing 733 zhdanstial equivalent to 825.2 standard days. Every third thequzdij has an additional zhdanstial.
Master of the Change, a Tliaqrnad who oversees adoptions
to feed, to give food to
throwing blade'. Name of a 10-ton light anti-shipping missile fighter.
Name of a class of 600-ton escort.
'one who grinds grain'. Often translated to Anglic as 'miller'. A common prole family name.
This Zhodani megacorporation is the Consulate's largest defence contractor and major military starship builder.
'returning journey'. Official name for the Second Core Expedition.
a letter, as in a symbol corresponding to a phoneme
a creature resembling a six-legged rabbit, but with the temperament of an African honey badger.
An Ancient artefact which projected a three dimensional starmap of space between Zhdant and the galactic core.
'the eye and the hand' The Consulate's primary intelligence and covert operations agency.
'to shine'. Often used as a suffix to modify other words.
Zhodani megacorporation involved in interface trade with the Vargr Extents.
The Ancient city built on Viepchakl and destroyed in the Final War.
'moonday' a festival of wild abandon held between Atrint and Vrienstial.
'people of Viepchakl'. The Droyne/Chirper race which lived on Viepchakl until the Dzagtlas made them extinct.
Consulate province which encompasses all Zhodani claimed territory coreward of Chtierabl province.
'superior guardians'. Official name for the psionically powerful religious oligarchy on Batlpat (1326 Ziafrplians).
'superior path'. Official name for the philosophy followed by the religious dictatorship on Batlpat (1326 Ziafrplians).
'star lord'. Name of a class of 2000-ton frontier cruisers.
'star prince'. A 30-ton medium fighter carried aboard Vlezhdatl-class frontier cruisers.
bridge, flight deck, or CIC, usually abbreviated VVP
A winged predator native to Dleqiats' eastern desert on Zhdant which vaguely resembles a cross between a Terran bat and a scorpion.
A slow but reliable draft animal from Zhdant that has adapted well on many worlds in the Consulate.
a pen or other writing implement
to go on a trek; to travel (implies great distance and/or risk)
starboard (the right side of the ship as seen facing forward)
Standardised language used throughout the Zhodani Consulate.
A day, usually on Zhdant, but applied generically to any solar day
Zhodani homeworld in Pliebr's second orbit and also the sector in which the Zhodani homeworld is located.
The Ancient city built on the Qiknavra continent and destroyed during the Final War.
Refers to any of the six Zhodani holidays.
consularists'. Official name for the Sixth Core Expedition.
Final conquest of the frontier'. Official name for the Fourth Core Expedition.
forest understory between the floor and canopy
Name of a relatively unsuccessful class of 400-ton destroyer escorts.
Scavenger and reducer insects that fill the same niche as cockroaches and scarab beetles
supreme, as in Homo Zhdotlas, "supreme man"
raised to nobility'. All characters with a Social Standing of 11 or higher; Nobles.
noble born'. Character with Social Standing of 14.
Zhodani trek'. Official name for the Seventh Core Expedition.
an archaic term used to describe one who has incestuous sexual relations; literally "motherfucker".
A small animal native to Zhdant with the ability to change its colour and to some extent its shape
